para_sentences.para_0: At this point, you should be able to answer all of the following questions.
para_sentences.para_1: You should now be able to use more of the operators, functions and methods for strings. You should also be able to create, use, and manipulate lists, and also to use list comprehensions to create new lists.
para_sentences.para_2: If you are unsure of any of these answers, take some time to review the course materials. Feel free to post questions in Piazza or Teams. Next week's lessons will be easier if you have invested in mastering this week's learning outcomes.
para_sentences.para_3: Check the Explorations and Task List in the Lesson 6 - Overview to review learning materials and make sure you have completed all required activities for this week.

ul_0: What are a few of the operators/functions/methods you can use with strings?
What's the difference between using an operator  a function  or a method?
What is indexing? How do you index into a string?
What is slicing? How do you slice a string?
What is a list? Why are they useful?
How do you index and slice lists?
What are a few of the operators/functions/methods you can use with lists?
What is a list comprehension? How are they used?
